original_title: Sri Lanka merchandise exports down 14.6-pct in Oct 2023
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s exports fell 14.6 percent from a year ago to 898 million US dollars in October 2023, amid a fall in external demand, with apparels down 20 percent, the island’s export promotion office said.
In the 10 months to October, exports were down 19 percent to 4,030 million US dollars.

Apparel exports were down 20 percent to 353 million US dollars, tea was down 12 percent to 95.6 million US dollars, rubber-based products were down 7.6 percent to 79.7 percent and coconut-based products were down 17 percent to 59.6 million US dollars.
Amid strengthening of the US dollar, commodity prices like tea has fallen.
Exports to the US were down 13.8 percent to 206 million US dollars, UK was down 9.7 percent to 63.5 million US dollars and India was down 22 percent to 65 million US dollars.
The EU was down 23 percent to 213 million US dollars. (Colombo/Dec04/2023)
